title: Ultrasound Technologist / Sonographer I - Float
description:
Overview

United Vein & Vascular Centers is a rapidly growing national healthcare organization specializing in state-of-the-art, minimally invasive surgical vein and vascular treatments. With numerous clinics across Florida, Georgia, Colorado, Arizona, and Illinois, we have positively impacted the lives of thousands of patients. Our team of dedicated physicians and staff work together to deliver exceptional care, utilizing the latest technology and cutting-edge techniques. Join our growing team as we continue to revolutionize the industry and transform lives!

Responsibilities

The Ultrasound Technologist / Sonographer I will perform all ordered lower extremity vascular exams and assist the physician or provider with phlebology procedures. The Vascular Ultrasound Technologist I works as an active member of the healthcare team, providing safe, effective, and high-quality patient care. They assist in consistent patient education and participate in practice building initiatives and administrative tasks as time permits. This position will float between various clinics in the market.

 Assist the physician during endovenous laser ablation and microphlebectomy procedures.  Collaborate with other clinic staff in the set-up and clean-up of the treatment rooms before and after each session to maintain efficient patient flow.  Perform patient evaluation and assessment prior to ultrasound examination.  Complete all appropriate reports following each patient interaction, following UVVC written ultrasound protocols.  Perform ordered duplex ultrasound examination and other imaging studies.  Submit diagnostic findings that accurately reflet each patient's disease process.  Maintain equipment and image storage.  Assist with management of supply inventory.  Demonstrate and promote a work culture committed to UVVC’s Core Values: Understanding, Nurturing, Ingenuity, Trust, Excellence, and Diversity.  Demonstrate behaviors that are consistent with UVVC’s Standards of Conduct as outlined in our Employee Handbook.  Maintain the confidentiality and security of Protected Health Information (PHI) in accordance with UVVC policies, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and other applicable laws and regulations. PHI is a top priority of our organization.  Other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications

 Must be RVT, RVS or RPhS or eligible to sit for vascular credential.  If currently not certified, you will be required to test to obtain your certification within 90 days from your date of hire into the role. Attainment of your certification is required within 12 months of hire. Please note that failure to attain and maintain certification while employed with UVVC may be grounds for termination.  If certified, maintain vascular ultrasound credentials by being in good standing with CCI or ARDMS and earning the appropriate amount of CME each cycle period.  Once credentialed, obtain a minimum of 30 CME hours every 3 years which focus on vascular ultrasound.  Current Basic Life Support for Healthcare Provider (AHA).  Minimum 1 year experience performing vascular ultrasound scans preferred.  Prior experience with phlebology scans and assisting procedures preferred.  Demonstrate desire to learn, grow, and maintain knowledge of industry standards by joining groups, attending meetings, reading journals, and performing research. Suggested organizations: Society for Vascular Ultrasound (SVU), Society for Diagnostic Medical Sonography (SDMS), and the American Venous and Lymphatic Society (AVLS)  Dependable; able to meet reliable attendance and punctuality standards.  Must be willing and able to float between various clinics as needed.

 Competitive compensation package  Health, vision and dental benefits  401K plan  Life insurance (100% company paid)  PTO and paid holidays

Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Block. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.

Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Block and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.

There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.

Job Description

Square’s rapidly growing Square Banking has revolutionized the way businesses and consumers obtain the funding needed to achieve their goals. Unlike traditional business financing products, Square Banking extends offers to pre-qualified sellers with no application process, funds are deposited as soon as the next business day, and repayment happens as a fixed percentage of daily card sales. Since the product launched in 2014, Square Banking Credit has extended more than $9 billion to hundreds of thousands of sellers.

As a full-stack software engineer on the Credit Underwriting Team, you will help us grow and expand access to credit for our Square sellers. You will be responsible for designing, building and owning sophisticated underwriting services that leverage data and machine learning technologies to originate and approve a variety of lending products. Our customers are internal teams iterating on existing loan products as well as experimenting with brand new loan structures. Our backend is the powerhouse behind all of loan origination, and our frontend enables product teams to customize, test, and manage the credit policies behind these loans. You will work primarily on our backend systems with regular contributions to our frontend as well.

Qualifications
